df-subg
blocks.content: Define a subgroup of a group as a set of elements that is a group in its own right. Equivalently ( ~ issubg2 ), a subgroup is a subset of the group that is closed for the group internal operation (see ~ subgcl ), contains the neutral element of the group (see ~ subg0 ) and contains the inverses for all of its elements (see ~ subginvcl ). (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 2-Dec-2014.)

blocks.name: df-nsg
blocks.content: Define the equivalence relation in a quotient ring or quotient group (where ` i ` is a two-sided ideal or a normal subgroup). For non-normal subgroups this generates the left cosets. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 15-Jun-2015.)
blocks.origin:
axiom df-nsg(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5) {
  |- wceq(cnsg, cmpt(s0, cgrp, crab(s1, cfv(csubg, cv(s0)), wsbc(s2, cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), wsbc(s3, cfv(cplusg, cv(s0)), wral(s4, cv(s2), wral(s5, cv(s2), wb(wcel(co(cv(s4), cv(s3), cv(s5)), cv(s1)), wcel(co(cv(s5), cv(s3), cv(s4)), cv(s1))))))))))
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s2, s4)
  -| diffss(s2, s5)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s3, s4)
  -| diffss(s3, s5)
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s1, s4)
  -| diffss(s1, s5)
  -| diffss(s0, s4)
  -| diffss(s0, s5)
  -| diffss(s4, s5)
}
blocks.pretty:
axiom df-nsg(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5) {
  ‚ä¢ NrmSGrp =(s0 ‚àà Grp ‚Ü¶ { s1 ‚àà(SubGrp ` s0)|[(Base ` s0)/ s2][(+ ` s0)/ s3]‚àÄ(s4 ‚àà s2, ‚àÄ(s5 ‚àà s2,((s4[s3]s5)‚àà s1 ‚Üî(s5[s3]s4)‚àà s1)))})
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s5)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s3, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s3, s5)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s5)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s5)
  ‚ä£ d(s4, s5)
}

blocks.name: df-eqg
blocks.content: Define the equivalence relation in a group generated by a subgroup. More precisely, if ` G ` is a group and ` H ` is a subgroup, then ` G ~QG H ` is the equivalence relation on ` G ` associated with the left cosets of ` H ` . A typical application of this definition is the construction of the quotient group (resp. ring) of a group (resp. ring) by a normal subgroup (resp. two-sided ideal). (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 15-Jun-2015.)
blocks.origin:
axiom df-eqg(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3) {
  |- wceq(cqg, cmpo(s0, s1, universe, universe, copab(s2, s3, wa(wss(cpr(cv(s2), cv(s3)), cfv(cbs, cv(s0))), wcel(co(cfv(cfv(cminusg, cv(s0)), cv(s2)), cfv(cplusg, cv(s0)), cv(s3)), cv(s1))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
}
blocks.pretty:
axiom df-eqg(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3) {
  ‚ä¢ ~QG =(s0 ‚àà ùïå, s1 ‚àà ùïå ‚Ü¶ { < s2, s3 > |({ s2, s3 } ‚äÜ(Base ` s0)‚àß(((invg ` s0)` s2)[(+ ` s0)]s3)‚àà s1)})
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s3)
}

blocks.name: issubg
blocks.content: The subgroup predicate. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 2-Dec-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm issubg(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wb(wcel(c0, cfv(csubg, c1)), w3a(wcel(c1, cgrp), wss(c0, c2), wcel(co(c1, cress, c0), cgrp)))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cbs, c1))
} = {
  pm5.21nii(wcel(c0, cfv(csubg, c1)), w3a(wcel(c1, cgrp), wss(c0, c2), wcel(co(c1, cress, c0), cgrp)), wcel(c1, cgrp))
  mptrcl(hs0, c0, csubg, c1, cgrp, crab(hs1, cpw(cfv(cbs, cv(hs0))), wcel(co(cv(hs0), cress, cv(hs1)), cgrp)))
  simp1(wcel(c1, cgrp), wss(c0, c2), wcel(co(c1, cress, c0), cgrp))
  syl6bbr(wcel(c1, cgrp), wcel(c0, cfv(csubg, c1)), w3a(wcel(c1, cgrp), wss(c0, c2), wcel(co(c1, cress, c0), cgrp)), wa(wcel(c1, cgrp), wa(wss(c0, c2), wcel(co(c1, cress, c0), cgrp))))
  bitrd(wcel(c1, cgrp), wcel(c0, cfv(csubg, c1)), wa(wcel(c1, cgrp), wa(wss(c0, c2), wcel(co(c1, cress, c0), cgrp))), wa(wss(c0, c2), wcel(co(c1, cress, c0), cgrp)))
  syl6bb(wcel(c1, cgrp), wcel(c0, cfv(csubg, c1)), wa(wss(c0, c2), wcel(co(c1, cress, c0), cgrp)), wcel(c0, crab(hs1, cpw(c2), wcel(co(c1, cress, cv(hs1)), cgrp))))
  eleq2d(c0, cfv(csubg, c1), crab(hs1, cpw(c2), wcel(co(c1, cress, cv(hs1)), cgrp)), wcel(c1, cgrp))
  fvmpt(hs0, c1, cgrp, csubg, crab(hs1, cpw(c2), wcel(co(c1, cress, cv(hs1)), cgrp)), crab(hs1, cpw(cfv(cbs, cv(hs0))), wcel(co(cv(hs0), cress, cv(hs1)), cgrp)))
  rabeqbidv(hs1, cpw(cfv(cbs, cv(hs0))), cpw(c2), wceq(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(co(cv(hs0), cress, cv(hs1)), cgrp), wcel(co(c1, cress, cv(hs1)), cgrp))
  pweqd(cfv(cbs, cv(hs0)), c2, wceq(cv(hs0), c1))
  syl6eqr(cfv(cbs, cv(hs0)), c2, cfv(cbs, c1), wceq(cv(hs0), c1))
  fveq2(cv(hs0), c1, cbs)
  eleq1d(co(cv(hs0), cress, cv(hs1)), cgrp, co(c1, cress, cv(hs1)), wceq(cv(hs0), c1))
  oveq1(cv(hs0), c1, cress, cv(hs1))
  df-subg(hs0, hs1)
  rabex(hs1, cpw(c2), wcel(co(c1, cress, cv(hs1)), cgrp))
  pwex(c2)
  bitri(wcel(c0, crab(hs1, cpw(c2), wcel(co(c1, cress, cv(hs1)), cgrp))), wa(wss(c0, c2), wcel(co(c1, cress, c0), cgrp)), wa(wcel(c0, cpw(c2)), wcel(co(c1, cress, c0), cgrp)))
  elrab(hs1, c0, cpw(c2), wcel(co(c1, cress, cv(hs1)), cgrp), wcel(co(c1, cress, c0), cgrp))
  eleq1d(co(c1, cress, cv(hs1)), cgrp, co(c1, cress, c0), wceq(cv(hs1), c0))
  oveq2(cv(hs1), c0, c1, cress)
  anbi1i(wcel(c0, cpw(c2)), wcel(co(c1, cress, c0), cgrp), wss(c0, c2))
  elpw2(c0, c2)
  fvexi(c2, cbs, c1)
  ibar(wcel(c1, cgrp), wa(wss(c0, c2), wcel(co(c1, cress, c0), cgrp)))
  3anass(wcel(c1, cgrp), wss(c0, c2), wcel(co(c1, cress, c0), cgrp))
  diff.hs0.c(cgrp)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(crab(hs1, cpw(c2), wcel(co(c1, cress, cv(hs1)), cgrp)))
  diff.hs1.c(cpw(cfv(cbs, cv(hs0))))
  diff.hs1.c(cpw(c2))
  diff.hs1.w(wceq(cv(hs0), c1))
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.w(wcel(co(c1, cress, c0), cgrp))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm issubg(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  ‚ä¢ (c0 ‚àà(SubGrp ` c1)‚Üî(c1 ‚àà Grp ‚àß c0 ‚äÜ c2 ‚àß(c1[|`s]c0)‚àà Grp))
  ‚ä£ c2 =(Base ` c1)
} = {
  pm5.21nii(c0 ‚àà(SubGrp ` c1), (c1 ‚àà Grp ‚àß c0 ‚äÜ c2 ‚àß(c1[|`s]c0)‚àà Grp), c1 ‚àà Grp)
  mptrcl(hs0, c0, csubg, c1, cgrp, { hs1 ‚àà P((Base ` hs0))|(hs0[|`s]hs1)‚àà Grp })
  simp1(c1 ‚àà Grp, c0 ‚äÜ c2, (c1[|`s]c0)‚àà Grp)
  syl6bbr(c1 ‚àà Grp, c0 ‚àà(SubGrp ` c1), (c1 ‚àà Grp ‚àß c0 ‚äÜ c2 ‚àß(c1[|`s]c0)‚àà Grp), (c1 ‚àà Grp ‚àß(c0 ‚äÜ c2 ‚àß(c1[|`s]c0)‚àà Grp)))
  bitrd(c1 ‚àà Grp, c0 ‚àà(SubGrp ` c1), (c1 ‚àà Grp ‚àß(c0 ‚äÜ c2 ‚àß(c1[|`s]c0)‚àà Grp)), (c0 ‚äÜ c2 ‚àß(c1[|`s]c0)‚àà Grp))
  syl6bb(c1 ‚àà Grp, c0 ‚àà(SubGrp ` c1), (c0 ‚äÜ c2 ‚àß(c1[|`s]c0)‚àà Grp), c0 ‚àà { hs1 ‚àà P(c2)|(c1[|`s]hs1)‚àà Grp })
  eleq2d(c0, (SubGrp ` c1), { hs1 ‚àà P(c2)|(c1[|`s]hs1)‚àà Grp }, c1 ‚àà Grp)
  fvmpt(hs0, c1, cgrp, csubg, { hs1 ‚àà P(c2)|(c1[|`s]hs1)‚àà Grp }, { hs1 ‚àà P((Base ` hs0))|(hs0[|`s]hs1)‚àà Grp })
  rabeqbidv(hs1, P((Base ` hs0)), P(c2), hs0 = c1, (hs0[|`s]hs1)‚àà Grp, (c1[|`s]hs1)‚àà Grp)
  pweqd((Base ` hs0), c2, hs0 = c1)
  syl6eqr((Base ` hs0), c2, (Base ` c1), hs0 = c1)
  fveq2(hs0, c1, cbs)
  eleq1d((hs0[|`s]hs1), cgrp, (c1[|`s]hs1), hs0 = c1)
  oveq1(hs0, c1, cress, hs1)
  df-subg(hs0, hs1)
  rabex(hs1, P(c2), (c1[|`s]hs1)‚àà Grp)
  pwex(c2)
  bitri(c0 ‚àà { hs1 ‚àà P(c2)|(c1[|`s]hs1)‚àà Grp }, (c0 ‚äÜ c2 ‚àß(c1[|`s]c0)‚àà Grp), (c0 ‚àà P(c2)‚àß(c1[|`s]c0)‚àà Grp))
  elrab(hs1, c0, P(c2), (c1[|`s]hs1)‚àà Grp, (c1[|`s]c0)‚àà Grp)
  eleq1d((c1[|`s]hs1), cgrp, (c1[|`s]c0), hs1 = c0)
  oveq2(hs1, c0, c1, cress)
  anbi1i(c0 ‚àà P(c2), (c1[|`s]c0)‚àà Grp, c0 ‚äÜ c2)
  elpw2(c0, c2)
  fvexi(c2, cbs, c1)
  ibar(c1 ‚àà Grp, (c0 ‚äÜ c2 ‚àß(c1[|`s]c0)‚àà Grp))
  3anass(c1 ‚àà Grp, c0 ‚äÜ c2, (c1[|`s]c0)‚àà Grp)
  diff.hs0.c(cgrp)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c({ hs1 ‚àà P(c2)|(c1[|`s]hs1)‚àà Grp })
  diff.hs1.c(P((Base ` hs0)))
  diff.hs1.c(P(c2))
  diff.hs1.w(hs0 = c1)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.w((c1[|`s]c0)‚àà Grp)
}

blocks.name: subgss
blocks.content: A subgroup is a subset. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 2-Dec-2014.)

blocks.name: subgid
blocks.content: A group is a subgroup of itself. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 7-Dec-2014.)

blocks.name: subggrp
blocks.content: A subgroup is a group. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 2-Dec-2014.)

blocks.name: subgrcl

blocks.name: subg0
blocks.content: A subgroup of a group must have the same identity as the group. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 27-Nov-2014.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 30-Apr-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm subg0(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cfv(csubg, c1)), wceq(c2, cfv(c0g, c3)))
  -| wceq(c3, co(c1, cress, c0))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(c0g, c1))
} = {
  mpbid(wcel(c0, cfv(csubg, c1)), wceq(c2, cfv(c0g, c3)), wceq(co(cfv(c0g, c3), cfv(cplusg, c1), cfv(c0g, c3)), cfv(c0g, c3)))
  eqtrd(co(cfv(c0g, c3), cfv(cplusg, c1), cfv(c0g, c3)), cfv(c0g, c3), co(cfv(c0g, c3), cfv(cplusg, c3), cfv(c0g, c3)), wcel(c0, cfv(csubg, c1)))
  oveqd(cfv(c0g, c3), cfv(cplusg, c1), cfv(c0g, c3), cfv(cplusg, c3), wcel(c0, cfv(csubg, c1)))
  ressplusg(c0, cfv(csubg, c1), cfv(cplusg, c1), c3, c1)
  syl2anc(wcel(c0, cfv(csubg, c1)), wceq(co(cfv(c0g, c3), cfv(cplusg, c3), cfv(c0g, c3)), cfv(c0g, c3)), wcel(c3, cgrp), wcel(cfv(c0g, c3), cfv(cbs, c3)))
  grplid(c3, cfv(c0g, c3), cfv(cbs, c3), cfv(c0g, c3), cfv(cplusg, c3))
  eqid(cfv(cplusg, c3))
  syl2anc(wcel(c0, cfv(csubg, c1)), wb(wceq(co(cfv(c0g, c3), cfv(cplusg, c1), cfv(c0g, c3)), cfv(c0g, c3)), wceq(c2, cfv(c0g, c3))), wcel(c1, cgrp), wcel(cfv(c0g, c3), cfv(cbs, c1)))
  subgrcl(c0, c1)
  sseldd(cfv(c0g, c3), cfv(cbs, c1), c0, wcel(c0, cfv(csubg, c1)))
  subgss(c0, c1, cfv(cbs, c1))
  eleqtrrd(cfv(c0g, c3), c0, cfv(cbs, c3), wcel(c0, cfv(csubg, c1)))
  syl(wcel(c0, cfv(csubg, c1)), wcel(cfv(c0g, c3), cfv(cbs, c3)), wcel(c3, cgrp))
  subggrp(c0, c1, c3)
  grpidcl(c3, cfv(c0g, c3), cfv(cbs, c3))
  eqid(cfv(cbs, c3))
  eqid(cfv(c0g, c3))
  subgbas(c0, c1, c3)
  grpid(c1, cfv(c0g, c3), cfv(cbs, c1), cfv(cplusg, c1), c2)
  eqid(cfv(cbs, c1))
  eqid(cfv(cplusg, c1))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm subg0(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  ‚ä¢ (c0 ‚àà(SubGrp ` c1)‚Üí c2 =(0 ` c3))
  ‚ä£ c3 =(c1[|`s]c0)
  ‚ä£ c2 =(0 ` c1)
} = {
  mpbid(c0 ‚àà(SubGrp ` c1), c2 =(0 ` c3), ((0 ` c3)[(+ ` c1)](0 ` c3))=(0 ` c3))
  eqtrd(((0 ` c3)[(+ ` c1)](0 ` c3)), (0 ` c3), ((0 ` c3)[(+ ` c3)](0 ` c3)), c0 ‚àà(SubGrp ` c1))
  oveqd((0 ` c3), (+ ` c1), (0 ` c3), (+ ` c3), c0 ‚àà(SubGrp ` c1))
  ressplusg(c0, (SubGrp ` c1), (+ ` c1), c3, c1)
  syl2anc(c0 ‚àà(SubGrp ` c1), ((0 ` c3)[(+ ` c3)](0 ` c3))=(0 ` c3), c3 ‚àà Grp, (0 ` c3)‚àà(Base ` c3))
  grplid(c3, (0 ` c3), (Base ` c3), (0 ` c3), (+ ` c3))
  eqid((+ ` c3))
  syl2anc(c0 ‚àà(SubGrp ` c1), (((0 ` c3)[(+ ` c1)](0 ` c3))=(0 ` c3)‚Üî c2 =(0 ` c3)), c1 ‚àà Grp, (0 ` c3)‚àà(Base ` c1))
  subgrcl(c0, c1)
  sseldd((0 ` c3), (Base ` c1), c0, c0 ‚àà(SubGrp ` c1))
  subgss(c0, c1, (Base ` c1))
  eleqtrrd((0 ` c3), c0, (Base ` c3), c0 ‚àà(SubGrp ` c1))
  syl(c0 ‚àà(SubGrp ` c1), (0 ` c3)‚àà(Base ` c3), c3 ‚àà Grp)
  subggrp(c0, c1, c3)
  grpidcl(c3, (0 ` c3), (Base ` c3))
  eqid((Base ` c3))
  eqid((0 ` c3))
  subgbas(c0, c1, c3)
  grpid(c1, (0 ` c3), (Base ` c1), (+ ` c1), c2)
  eqid((Base ` c1))
  eqid((+ ` c1))
}

blocks.name: subginv
blocks.content: The inverse of an element in a subgroup is the same as the inverse in the larger group. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 2-Dec-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm subginv(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(csubg, c1)), wcel(c2, c0)), wceq(cfv(c3, c2), cfv(c4, c2)))
  -| wceq(c5, co(c1, cress, c0))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cminusg, c1))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cminusg, c5))
} = {
  mpbird(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(csubg, c1)), wcel(c2, c0)), wceq(cfv(c3, c2), cfv(c4, c2)), wceq(co(c2, cfv(cplusg, c1), cfv(c4, c2)), cfv(c0g, c1)))
  3eqtr4d(co(c2, cfv(cplusg, c1), cfv(c4, c2)), cfv(c0g, c1), co(c2, cfv(cplusg, c5), cfv(c4, c2)), cfv(c0g, c5), wa(wcel(c0, cfv(csubg, c1)), wcel(c2, c0)))
  syl2an2r(wcel(c0, cfv(csubg, c1)), wcel(c2, c0), wceq(co(c2, cfv(cplusg, c5), cfv(c4, c2)), cfv(c0g, c5)), wcel(c5, cgrp), wcel(c2, cfv(cbs, c5)))
  biimpa(wcel(c0, cfv(csubg, c1)), wcel(c2, c0), wcel(c2, cfv(cbs, c5)))
  grprinv(c5, c2, cfv(cbs, c5), cfv(cplusg, c5), c4, cfv(c0g, c5))
  eqid(cfv(cplusg, c5))
  eqid(cfv(c0g, c5))
  oveqd(c2, cfv(cplusg, c1), cfv(c4, c2), cfv(cplusg, c5), wa(wcel(c0, cfv(csubg, c1)), wcel(c2, c0)))
  adantr(wcel(c0, cfv(csubg, c1)), wcel(c2, c0), wceq(cfv(cplusg, c1), cfv(cplusg, c5)))
  ressplusg(c0, cfv(csubg, c1), cfv(cplusg, c1), c5, c1)
  adantr(wcel(c0, cfv(csubg, c1)), wcel(c2, c0), wceq(cfv(c0g, c1), cfv(c0g, c5)))
  subg0(c0, c1, cfv(c0g, c1), c5)
  syl3anc(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(csubg, c1)), wcel(c2, c0)), wb(wceq(cfv(c3, c2), cfv(c4, c2)), wceq(co(c2, cfv(cplusg, c1), cfv(c4, c2)), cfv(c0g, c1))), wcel(c1, cgrp), wcel(c2, cfv(cbs, c1)), wcel(cfv(c4, c2), cfv(cbs, c1)))
  adantr(wcel(c0, cfv(csubg, c1)), wcel(c2, c0), wcel(c1, cgrp))
  subgrcl(c0, c1)

  jca((w0 ‚àß s0 ‚àà c0), ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà c0,(s0[(+ ` c1)]s1)‚àà c0), ((invg ` c1)` s0)‚àà c0)

thm issubgrpd(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, wff w0) {

  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c2)), wcel(cfv(cfv(cminusg, c1), cv(s0)), c2))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, cgrp))

  -| diffsc(s0, c1)

  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)

  -| diffsc(s1, c4)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
  -| diffsw(s1, w0)
} = {
  eqeltrd(c0, cgrp, co(c1, cress, c2), w0)

  issubgrpd2(s0, s1, c2, c1, c0, c3, c4, w0)
  subggrp(c2, c1, co(c1, cress, c2))

}

blocks.name: grpissubg
blocks.content: If the base set of a group is contained in the base set of another group, and the group operation of the group is the restriction of the group operation of the other group to its base set, then the (base set of the) group is subgroup of the other group. (Contributed by AV, 14-Mar-2019.)
blocks.origin:
thm grpissubg(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, cgrp)), wi(wa(wss(c2, c3), wceq(cfv(cplusg, c1), cres(cfv(cplusg, c0), cxp(c2, c2)))), wcel(c2, cfv(csubg, c0))))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cbs, c0))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cbs, c1))

blocks.name: resgrpisgrp
blocks.content: If the base set of a group is contained in the base set of another group, and the group operation of the group is the restriction of the group operation of the other group to its base set, then the other group restricted to the base set of the group is a group. (Contributed by AV, 14-Mar-2019.)
blocks.origin:
thm resgrpisgrp(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {

} = {

  imp(wa(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, cgrp)), wa(wss(c2, c3), wceq(cfv(cplusg, c1), cres(cfv(cplusg, c0), cxp(c2, c2)))), wcel(c2, cfv(csubg, c0)))
  grpissubg(c0, c1, c2, c3)
  syl6bbr(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, cgrp)), wa(wss(c2, c3), wceq(cfv(cplusg, c1), cres(cfv(cplusg, c0), cxp(c2, c2))))), wcel(co(c0, cress, c2), cgrp), wcel(c2, cfv(csubg, c0)), w3a(wcel(c0, cgrp), wss(c2, c3), wcel(co(c0, cress, c2), cgrp)))
  syl6bbr(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, cgrp)), wa(wss(c2, c3), wceq(cfv(cplusg, c1), cres(cfv(cplusg, c0), cxp(c2, c2))))), wcel(co(c0, cress, c2), cgrp), w3a(wcel(c0, cgrp), wss(c2, c3), wcel(co(c0, cress, c2), cgrp)), wa(wa(wcel(c0, cgrp), wss(c2, c3)), wcel(co(c0, cress, c2), cgrp)))

  ibar(wa(wcel(c0, cgrp), wss(c2, c3)), wcel(co(c0, cress, c2), cgrp))
  df-3an(wcel(c0, cgrp), wss(c2, c3), wcel(co(c0, cress, c2), cgrp))
  issubg(c2, c0, c3)

blocks.name: cycsubgcl
blocks.content: The set of integer powers of an element ` A ` of a group forms a subgroup containing ` A ` , called the cyclic group generated by the element ` A ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 13-Jan-2015.)

blocks.name: cycsubgss
blocks.content: The cyclic subgroup generated by an element ` A ` is a subset of any subgroup containing ` A ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 13-Jan-2015.)

thm cycsubgss(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(csubg, c1)), wcel(c2, c0)), wss(crn(c3), c0))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cbs, c1))

  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
  -| diffsc(s0, c5)
} = {
  a1ii(wi(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(csubg, c1)), wcel(c2, c0)), wss(crn(c3), c0)), wceq(c4, cfv(cbs, c1)))
  a1ii(wi(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(csubg, c1)), wcel(c2, c0)), wss(crn(c3), c0)), diffsc(s0, c4))

  3expa(wcel(c0, cfv(csubg, c1)), wcel(cv(s0), cz), wcel(c2, c0), wcel(co(cv(s0), c5, c2), c0))
  subgmulgcl(c0, c1, cv(s0), c2, c5)
  diff.cz.s(s0)
  diff.wa.s(s0, wcel(c0, cfv(csubg, c1)), wcel(c2, c0))
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c0, cfv(csubg, c1))
  diff.cfv.s(s0, csubg, c1)

thm cycsubgss(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5) {
  ‚ä¢ ((c0 ‚àà(SubGrp ` c1)‚àß c2 ‚àà c0)‚Üí ran(c3)‚äÜ c0)
  ‚ä£ c4 =(Base ` c1)
  ‚ä£ c5 =(.g ` c1)
  ‚ä£ c3 =(s0 ‚àà ‚Ñ§ ‚Ü¶(s0[c5]c2))
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c4)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c5)
} = {
  a1ii(((c0 ‚àà(SubGrp ` c1)‚àß c2 ‚àà c0)‚Üí ran(c3)‚äÜ c0), c4 =(Base ` c1))
  a1ii(((c0 ‚àà(SubGrp ` c1)‚àß c2 ‚àà c0)‚Üí ran(c3)‚äÜ c0), d(s0, c4))
  a1ii(((c0 ‚àà(SubGrp ` c1)‚àß c2 ‚àà c0)‚Üí ran(c3)‚äÜ c0), d(s0, c5))
  frnd(c3, c0, cz, (c0 ‚àà(SubGrp ` c1)‚àß c2 ‚àà c0))
  fmptd(s0, c3, cz, c0, (s0[c5]c2), (c0 ‚àà(SubGrp ` c1)‚àß c2 ‚àà c0))
  an32s(c0 ‚àà(SubGrp ` c1), c2 ‚àà c0, s0 ‚àà ‚Ñ§, (s0[c5]c2)‚àà c0)
  3expa(c0 ‚àà(SubGrp ` c1), s0 ‚àà ‚Ñ§, c2 ‚àà c0, (s0[c5]c2)‚àà c0)
  subgmulgcl(c0, c1, s0, c2, c5)

}

blocks.name: cycsubg
blocks.content: The cyclic group generated by ` A ` is the smallest subgroup containing ` A ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 13-Jan-2015.)

thm cycsubg(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, c2)), wceq(crn(c3), cint(crab(s0, cfv(csubg, c0), wcel(c1, cv(s0))))))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cbs, c0))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cmg, c0))
  -| wceq(c3, cmpt(s1, cz, co(cv(s1), c4, c1)))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c4)
} = {
  eqssd(crn(c3), cint(crab(s0, cfv(csubg, c0), wcel(c1, cv(s0)))), wa(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, c2)))
  a1i(wa(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, c2)), wss(crn(c3), cint(crab(s0, cfv(csubg, c0), wcel(c1, cv(s0))))))
  sseqtr4i(crn(c3), cint(crab(s0, cfv(csubg, c0), wcel(c1, cv(s0)))), cint(cab(s0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), cfv(csubg, c0)), wcel(c1, cv(s0))))))
  mpgbir(s0, wss(crn(c3), cint(cab(s0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), cfv(csubg, c0)), wcel(c1, cv(s0)))))), wi(wa(wcel(cv(s0), cfv(csubg, c0)), wcel(c1, cv(s0))), wss(crn(c3), cv(s0))))
  ssintab(s0, crn(c3), wa(wcel(cv(s0), cfv(csubg, c0)), wcel(c1, cv(s0))))
  cycsubgss(s1, cv(s0), c0, c1, c3, c2, c4)
  inteqi(crab(s0, cfv(csubg, c0), wcel(c1, cv(s0))), cab(s0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), cfv(csubg, c0)), wcel(c1, cv(s0)))))
  df-rab(s0, cfv(csubg, c0), wcel(c1, cv(s0)))
  syl(wa(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, c2)), wss(cint(crab(s0, cfv(csubg, c0), wcel(c1, cv(s0)))), crn(c3)), wcel(crn(c3), crab(s0, cfv(csubg, c0), wcel(c1, cv(s0)))))
  sylibr(wa(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, c2)), wcel(crn(c3), crab(s0, cfv(csubg, c0), wcel(c1, cv(s0)))), wa(wcel(crn(c3), cfv(csubg, c0)), wcel(c1, crn(c3))))
  cycsubgcl(s1, c0, c1, c2, c3, c4)
  elrab(s0, crn(c3), cfv(csubg, c0), wcel(c1, cv(s0)), wcel(c1, crn(c3)))
  eleq2(cv(s0), crn(c3), c1)
  intss1(crn(c3), crab(s0, cfv(csubg, c0), wcel(c1, cv(s0))))
  diff.cv.s(s1, s0)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
  diff.cfv.s(s0, csubg, c0)
  diff.csubg.s(s0)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c1, crn(c3))
  diff.crn.s(s0, c3)
}

  ‚ä¢ ((c0 ‚àà Grp ‚àß c1 ‚àà c2)‚Üí ran(c3)= ‚ãÇ { s0 ‚àà(SubGrp ` c0)| c1 ‚àà s0 })

  mpgbir(s0, ran(c3)‚äÜ ‚ãÇ { s0 |(s0 ‚àà(SubGrp ` c0)‚àß c1 ‚àà s0)}, ((s0 ‚àà(SubGrp ` c0)‚àß c1 ‚àà s0)‚Üí ran(c3)‚äÜ s0))
  ssintab(s0, ran(c3), (s0 ‚àà(SubGrp ` c0)‚àß c1 ‚àà s0))

  sylibr((c0 ‚àà Grp ‚àß c1 ‚àà c2), ran(c3)‚àà { s0 ‚àà(SubGrp ` c0)| c1 ‚àà s0 }, (ran(c3)‚àà(SubGrp ` c0)‚àß c1 ‚àà ran(c3)))
  cycsubgcl(s1, c0, c1, c2, c3, c4)

blocks.name: cycsubg2
blocks.content: The subgroup generated by an element is exhausted by its multiples. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 6-Sep-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm cycsubg2(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, c2)), wceq(cfv(c3, csn(c1)), crn(c4)))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cbs, c0))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(cmg, c0))
  -| wceq(c4, cmpt(s0, cz, co(cv(s0), c5, c1)))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cmrc, cfv(csubg, c0)))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c5)
} = {
  3eqtr4d(cfv(c3, csn(c1)), crn(c4), cint(crab(hs0, cfv(csubg, c0), wss(csn(c1), cv(hs0)))), cint(crab(hs0, cfv(csubg, c0), wcel(c1, cv(hs0)))), wa(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, c2)))
  inteqd(crab(hs0, cfv(csubg, c0), wss(csn(c1), cv(hs0))), crab(hs0, cfv(csubg, c0), wcel(c1, cv(hs0))), wa(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, c2)))
  rabbidv(hs0, cfv(csubg, c0), wa(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, c2)), wss(csn(c1), cv(hs0)), wcel(c1, cv(hs0)))
  adantl(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, c2), wb(wss(csn(c1), cv(hs0)), wcel(c1, cv(hs0))))
  bicomd(wcel(c1, c2), wss(csn(c1), cv(hs0)), wcel(c1, cv(hs0)))
  snssg(c1, c2, cv(hs0))
  syl2an(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, c2), wceq(cfv(c3, csn(c1)), cint(crab(hs0, cfv(csubg, c0), wss(csn(c1), cv(hs0))))), wcel(cfv(csubg, c0), cfv(cmre, c2)), wss(csn(c1), c2))
  acsmred(cfv(csubg, c0), c2, wcel(c0, cgrp))
  subgacs(c0, c2)
  snssi(c1, c2)
  mrcval(hs0, cfv(csubg, c0), c2, csn(c1), c3)

  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c4)
}

blocks.name: cycsubg2cl
blocks.content: Any multiple of an element is contained in the generated cyclic subgroup. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 12-Sep-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm cycsubg2cl(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, cz)), wcel(co(c3, c4, c1), cfv(c5, csn(c1))))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cbs, c0))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cmg, c0))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(cmrc, cfv(csubg, c0)))
} = {
  syl3anc(w3a(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, cz)), wcel(co(c3, c4, c1), cfv(c5, csn(c1))), wcel(cfv(c5, csn(c1)), cfv(csubg, c0)), wcel(c3, cz), wcel(c1, cfv(c5, csn(c1))))
  syl2anc(w3a(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, cz)), wcel(cfv(c5, csn(c1)), cfv(csubg, c0)), wcel(cfv(csubg, c0), cfv(cmre, c2)), wss(csn(c1), c2))
  mrccl(cfv(csubg, c0), c2, csn(c1), c5)
  simp3(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, cz))
  mpbird(w3a(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, cz)), wcel(c1, cfv(c5, csn(c1))), wss(csn(c1), cfv(c5, csn(c1))))
  mrcssidd(csn(c1), c5, cfv(csubg, c0), c2, w3a(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, cz)))
  3ad2ant1(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, cz), wcel(cfv(csubg, c0), cfv(cmre, c2)))
  acsmred(cfv(csubg, c0), c2, wcel(c0, cgrp))
  subgacs(c0, c2)
  snssd(c1, c2, w3a(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, cz)))
  simp2(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, cz))
  3ad2ant2(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, cz), wb(wcel(c1, cfv(c5, csn(c1))), wss(csn(c1), cfv(c5, csn(c1)))))
  snssg(c1, c2, cfv(c5, csn(c1)))
  subgmulgcl(cfv(c5, csn(c1)), c0, c3, c1, c4)
}

thm elnmz(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {

  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)

  -| diffsc(s1, c0)

blocks.name: ssnmz
blocks.content: A subgroup is a subset of its normalizer. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 18-Jan-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm ssnmz(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cfv(csubg, c1)), wss(c0, c2))

  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cbs, c1))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cplusg, c1))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c4)
} = {
  a1ii(wi(wcel(c0, cfv(csubg, c1)), wss(c0, c2)), diffsc(s0, c1))
  a1ii(wi(wcel(c0, cfv(csubg, c1)), wss(c0, c2)), diffsc(s1, c1))

  ralrimiva(hs1, c3, wa(wcel(c0, cfv(csubg, c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), c0)), wb(wcel(co(cv(hs0), c4, cv(hs1)), c0), wcel(co(cv(hs1), c4, cv(hs0)), c0)))

  eqeltrrd(cv(hs1), c0, co(cfv(cfv(cminusg, c1), cv(hs0)), c4, co(cv(hs0), c4, cv(hs1))), wa(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(csubg, c1)), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(cv(hs1), c3))), wcel(co(cv(hs0), c4, cv(hs1)), c0)))

blocks.name: isnsg4
blocks.content: A subgroup is normal iff its normalizer is the entire group. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 18-Jan-2015.)

thm isnsg4(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  |- wb(wcel(c0, cfv(cnsg, c1)), wa(wcel(c0, cfv(csubg, c1)), wceq(c2, c3)))
  -| wceq(c2, crab(s0, c3, wral(s1, c3, wb(wcel(co(cv(s0), c4, cv(s1)), c0), wcel(co(cv(s1), c4, cv(s0)), c0)))))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cbs, c1))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cplusg, c1))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c4)
} = {
  bitr4i(wcel(c0, cfv(cnsg, c1)), wa(wcel(c0, cfv(csubg, c1)), wceq(c2, c3)), wa(wcel(c0, cfv(csubg, c1)), wral(s0, c3, wral(s1, c3, wb(wcel(co(cv(s0), c4, cv(s1)), c0), wcel(co(cv(s1), c4, cv(s0)), c0))))))
  isnsg(s0, s1, c0, c1, c3, c4)
  anbi2i(wcel(c0, cfv(csubg, c1)), wceq(c2, c3), wral(s0, c3, wral(s1, c3, wb(wcel(co(cv(s0), c4, cv(s1)), c0), wcel(co(cv(s1), c4, cv(s0)), c0)))))
  3bitri(wceq(c2, c3), wral(s0, c3, wral(s1, c3, wb(wcel(co(cv(s0), c4, cv(s1)), c0), wcel(co(cv(s1), c4, cv(s0)), c0)))), wceq(c3, c2), wceq(c3, crab(s0, c3, wral(s1, c3, wb(wcel(co(cv(s0), c4, cv(s1)), c0), wcel(co(cv(s1), c4, cv(s0)), c0))))))
  eqcom(c2, c3)
  eqeq2i(c3, c2, crab(s0, c3, wral(s1, c3, wb(wcel(co(cv(s0), c4, cv(s1)), c0), wcel(co(cv(s1), c4, cv(s0)), c0)))))
  rabid2(s0, c3, wral(s1, c3, wb(wcel(co(cv(s0), c4, cv(s1)), c0), wcel(co(cv(s1), c4, cv(s0)), c0))))
}

blocks.name: eqglact
blocks.content: A left coset can be expressed as the image of a left action. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 20-Sep-2015.)

thm eqgid(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cfv(csubg, c1)), wceq(cec(c2, c3), c0))

  grplid(c1, cv(hs0), c4, c2, cfv(cplusg, c1))
  syl21anc(wcel(c0, cfv(csubg, c1)), wb(wbr(c2, c3, cv(hs0)), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c4), wcel(co(cfv(cfv(cminusg, c1), c2), cfv(cplusg, c1), cv(hs0)), c0))), wcel(c1, cgrp), wss(c0, c4), wcel(c2, c4))
  syl(wcel(c0, cfv(csubg, c1)), wcel(c2, c4), wcel(c1, cgrp))
  subgrcl(c0, c1)
  grpidcl(c1, c2, c4)
  baibd(wa(wcel(c1, cgrp), wss(c0, c4)), wcel(c2, c4), wbr(c2, c3, cv(hs0)), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c4), wcel(co(cfv(cfv(cminusg, c1), c2), cfv(cplusg, c1), cv(hs0)), c0)))
  syl6bb(wa(wcel(c1, cgrp), wss(c0, c4)), wbr(c2, c3, cv(hs0)), wa(wcel(c2, c4), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c4), wcel(co(cfv(cfv(cminusg, c1), c2), cfv(cplusg, c1), cv(hs0)), c0))), w3a(wcel(c2, c4), wcel(cv(hs0), c4), wcel(co(cfv(cfv(cminusg, c1), c2), cfv(cplusg, c1), cv(hs0)), c0)))

thm eqgid(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  ‚ä¢ (c0 ‚àà(SubGrp ` c1)‚Üí[c2]c3 = c0)
  ‚ä£ c4 =(Base ` c1)
  ‚ä£ c3 =(c1[~QG]c0)

} = {
  eqrdv(hs0, [c2]c3, c0, c0 ‚àà(SubGrp ` c1))
  syl5bb(c0 ‚àà(SubGrp ` c1), hs0 ‚àà[c2]c3, hs0 ‚àà c0, c2[c3]hs0)
  ax-mp((hs0 ‚àà[c2]c3 ‚Üî c2[c3]hs0), Rel(c3))

  eqtrd((((invg ` c1)` c2)[(+ ` c1)]hs0), hs0, (c2[(+ ` c1)]hs0), (c0 ‚àà(SubGrp ` c1)‚àß hs0 ‚àà c4))
  oveq1d(((invg ` c1)` c2), (+ ` c1), hs0, c2, (c0 ‚àà(SubGrp ` c1)‚àß hs0 ‚àà c4))
  syl((c0 ‚àà(SubGrp ` c1)‚àß hs0 ‚àà c4), ((invg ` c1)` c2)= c2, c1 ‚àà Grp)

  grplid(c1, hs0, c4, c2, (+ ` c1))

  syl(c0 ‚àà(SubGrp ` c1), c2 ‚àà c4, c1 ‚àà Grp)

  grpidcl(c1, c2, c4)
  baibd((c1 ‚àà Grp ‚àß c0 ‚äÜ c4), c2 ‚àà c4, c2[c3]hs0, (hs0 ‚àà c4 ‚àß(((invg ` c1)` c2)[(+ ` c1)]hs0)‚àà c0))
  syl6bb((c1 ‚àà Grp ‚àß c0 ‚äÜ c4), c2[c3]hs0, (c2 ‚àà c4 ‚àß(hs0 ‚àà c4 ‚àß(((invg ` c1)` c2)[(+ ` c1)]hs0)‚àà c0)), (c2 ‚àà c4 ‚àß hs0 ‚àà c4 ‚àß(((invg ` c1)` c2)[(+ ` c1)]hs0)‚àà c0))
  eqgval(c1, cgrp, c0, c4, c2, c3, hs0, (invg ` c1), (+ ` c1))

  eqid((+ ` c1))
  3anass(c2 ‚àà c4, hs0 ‚àà c4, (((invg ` c1)` c2)[(+ ` c1)]hs0)‚àà c0)
  pm4.71rd(c0 ‚àà(SubGrp ` c1), hs0 ‚àà c0, hs0 ‚àà c4)

  sylan(wcel(c0, cfv(csubg, c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), c3), wf1o(cmpt(hs1, c3, co(cv(hs0), cfv(cplusg, c1), cv(hs1))), c3, c3), wcel(c1, cgrp))

  syl(wa(wcel(c1, cgrp), wcel(cv(hs0), c3)), wb(wf1o(cfv(cmpt(hs2, c3, cmpt(hs1, c3, co(cv(hs2), cfv(cplusg, c1), cv(hs1)))), cv(hs0)), c3, c3), wf1o(cmpt(hs1, c3, co(cv(hs0), cfv(cplusg, c1), cv(hs1))), c3, c3)), wceq(cfv(cmpt(hs2, c3, cmpt(hs1, c3, co(cv(hs2), cfv(cplusg, c1), cv(hs1)))), cv(hs0)), cmpt(hs1, c3, co(cv(hs0), cfv(cplusg, c1), cv(hs1)))))

  ectocld(hs0, c2, (c3 /. c4), c3, c4, c0 ‚àà(SubGrp ` c1), c0[‚âÖ]c2, c0[‚âÖ][hs0]c4)

  simpl(c0 ‚àà(SubGrp ` c1), hs0 ‚àà c3)
  syl6eqelr(((hs1 ‚àà c3 ‚Ü¶(hs0[(+ ` c1)]hs1))" c0), universe, [hs0]c4, (c0 ‚àà(SubGrp ` c1)‚àß hs0 ‚àà c3))
  ax-mp([hs0]c4 ‚àà ùïå, c4 ‚àà ùïå)

blocks.name: eqgcpbl
blocks.content: The subgroup coset equivalence relation is compatible with addition when the subgroup is normal. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 14-Jun-2015.)

blocks.name: qusgrp
blocks.content: If ` Y ` is a normal subgroup of ` G ` , then ` H = G / Y ` is a group, called the quotient of ` G ` by ` Y ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 14-Jun-2015.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 12-Aug-2015.)
blocks.origin:

  |- wi(wcel(c0, cfv(cnsg, c1)), wcel(c2, cgrp))

thm quseccl(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cnsg, c1)), wcel(c2, c3)), wcel(cec(c2, co(c1, cqg, c0)), c4))
  -| wceq(c5, co(c1, cqus, co(c1, cqg, c0)))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cbs, c1))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cbs, c5))
} = {
  eleqtrd(cec(c2, co(c1, cqg, c0)), c4, cqs(c3, co(c1, cqg, c0)), wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cnsg, c1)), wcel(c2, c3)))
  adantl(wcel(c0, cfv(cnsg, c1)), wcel(c2, c3), wcel(cec(c2, co(c1, cqg, c0)), cqs(c3, co(c1, cqg, c0))))
  ecelqsi(c2, c3, co(c1, cqg, c0))
  syl6eqr(cqs(c3, co(c1, cqg, c0)), c4, cfv(cbs, c5), wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cnsg, c1)), wcel(c2, c3)))
  qusbas(c3, co(c1, cqg, c0), c5, c1, universe, cgrp, wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cnsg, c1)), wcel(c2, c3)))
  a1i(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cnsg, c1)), wcel(c2, c3)), wceq(c5, co(c1, cqus, co(c1, cqg, c0))))
  a1i(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cnsg, c1)), wcel(c2, c3)), wceq(c3, cfv(cbs, c1)))
  a1i(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cnsg, c1)), wcel(c2, c3)), wcel(co(c1, cqg, c0), universe))
  ovex(c1, cqg, c0)
  adantr(wcel(c0, cfv(cnsg, c1)), wcel(c2, c3), wcel(c1, cgrp))
  syl(wcel(c0, cfv(cnsg, c1)), wcel(c1, cgrp), wcel(c0, cfv(csubg, c1)))

  subgrcl(c0, c1)
}

  3adant2(wcel(c0, cfv(cnsg, c1)), wcel(c2, c3), wcel(c4, c3), wcel(cfv(cfv(cminusg, c1), c4), c3))
  sylan(wcel(c0, cfv(cnsg, c1)), wcel(c4, c3), wcel(cfv(cfv(cminusg, c1), c4), c3), wcel(c1, cgrp))
  syl(wcel(c0, cfv(cnsg, c1)), wcel(c1, cgrp), wcel(c0, cfv(csubg, c1)))
  nsgsubg(c0, c1)
  subgrcl(c0, c1)
  grpinvcl(c1, c4, c3, cfv(cminusg, c1))
  qusadd(c0, c1, c2, c3, cfv(cfv(cminusg, c1), c4), cfv(cplusg, c7), cfv(cplusg, c1), c7)
  eqid(cfv(cplusg, c7))
  eceq1d(co(c2, c6, c4), co(c1, cqg, c0), co(c2, cfv(cplusg, c1), cfv(cfv(cminusg, c1), c4)), w3a(wcel(c0, cfv(cnsg, c1)), wcel(c2, c3), wcel(c4, c3)))
  3adant1(wcel(c0, cfv(cnsg, c1)), wcel(c2, c3), wcel(c4, c3), wceq(co(c2, c6, c4), co(c2, cfv(cplusg, c1), cfv(cfv(cminusg, c1), c4))))
  grpsubval(c2, c3, c4, c6, cfv(cplusg, c1), cfv(cminusg, c1), c1)

  eqid(cfv(cminusg, c1))
}

thm qussub(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7) {
  ‚ä¢ ((c0 ‚àà(NrmSGrp ` c1)‚àß c2 ‚àà c3 ‚àß c4 ‚àà c3)‚Üí([c2](c1[~QG]c0)[c5][c4](c1[~QG]c0))=[(c2[c6]c4)](c1[~QG]c0))
  ‚ä£ c7 =(c1[/s](c1[~QG]c0))
  ‚ä£ c3 =(Base ` c1)
  ‚ä£ c6 =(-g ` c1)
  ‚ä£ c5 =(-g ` c7)
} = {
  3eqtrd(([c2](c1[~QG]c0)[c5][c4](c1[~QG]c0)), [(c2[c6]c4)](c1[~QG]c0), ([c2](c1[~QG]c0)[(+ ` c7)]((invg ` c7)`[c4](c1[~QG]c0))), ([c2](c1[~QG]c0)[(+ ` c7)][((invg ` c1)` c4)](c1[~QG]c0)), (c0 ‚àà(NrmSGrp ` c1)‚àß c2 ‚àà c3 ‚àß c4 ‚àà c3))
  3imp3i2an(c0 ‚àà(NrmSGrp ` c1), c2 ‚àà c3, c4 ‚àà c3, ([c2](c1[~QG]c0)[c5][c4](c1[~QG]c0))=([c2](c1[~QG]c0)[(+ ` c7)]((invg ` c7)`[c4](c1[~QG]c0))), [c2](c1[~QG]c0)‚àà(Base ` c7), [c4](c1[~QG]c0)‚àà(Base ` c7))
  3adant3(c0 ‚àà(NrmSGrp ` c1), c2 ‚àà c3, c4 ‚àà c3, [c2](c1[~QG]c0)‚àà(Base ` c7))
  quseccl(c0, c1, c2, c3, (Base ` c7), c7)
  quseccl(c0, c1, c4, c3, (Base ` c7), c7)
  grpsubval([c2](c1[~QG]c0), (Base ` c7), [c4](c1[~QG]c0), c5, (+ ` c7), (invg ` c7), c7)
  eqid((Base ` c7))
  oveq2d([c2](c1[~QG]c0), (+ ` c7), ((invg ` c7)`[c4](c1[~QG]c0)), [((invg ` c1)` c4)](c1[~QG]c0), (c0 ‚àà(NrmSGrp ` c1)‚àß c2 ‚àà c3 ‚àß c4 ‚àà c3))
  3adant2(c0 ‚àà(NrmSGrp ` c1), c2 ‚àà c3, c4 ‚àà c3, ((invg ` c7)`[c4](c1[~QG]c0))=[((invg ` c1)` c4)](c1[~QG]c0))
  qusinv(c0, c1, c4, c3, (invg ` c7), (invg ` c1), c7)
  eqid((invg ` c7))
  eqtr4d(([c2](c1[~QG]c0)[(+ ` c7)][((invg ` c1)` c4)](c1[~QG]c0)), [(c2[c6]c4)](c1[~QG]c0), [(c2[(+ ` c1)]((invg ` c1)` c4))](c1[~QG]c0), (c0 ‚àà(NrmSGrp ` c1)‚àß c2 ‚àà c3 ‚àß c4 ‚àà c3))
  syld3an3(c0 ‚àà(NrmSGrp ` c1), c2 ‚àà c3, c4 ‚àà c3, ([c2](c1[~QG]c0)[(+ ` c7)][((invg ` c1)` c4)](c1[~QG]c0))=[(c2[(+ ` c1)]((invg ` c1)` c4))](c1[~QG]c0), ((invg ` c1)` c4)‚àà c3)
  3adant2(c0 ‚àà(NrmSGrp ` c1), c2 ‚àà c3, c4 ‚àà c3, ((invg ` c1)` c4)‚àà c3)
  sylan(c0 ‚àà(NrmSGrp ` c1), c4 ‚àà c3, ((invg ` c1)` c4)‚àà c3, c1 ‚àà Grp)
  syl(c0 ‚àà(NrmSGrp ` c1), c1 ‚àà Grp, c0 ‚àà(SubGrp ` c1))
  nsgsubg(c0, c1)
  subgrcl(c0, c1)
  grpinvcl(c1, c4, c3, (invg ` c1))
  qusadd(c0, c1, c2, c3, ((invg ` c1)` c4), (+ ` c7), (+ ` c1), c7)
  eqid((+ ` c7))
  eceq1d((c2[c6]c4), (c1[~QG]c0), (c2[(+ ` c1)]((invg ` c1)` c4)), (c0 ‚àà(NrmSGrp ` c1)‚àß c2 ‚àà c3 ‚àß c4 ‚àà c3))
  3adant1(c0 ‚àà(NrmSGrp ` c1), c2 ‚àà c3, c4 ‚àà c3, (c2[c6]c4)=(c2[(+ ` c1)]((invg ` c1)` c4)))
  grpsubval(c2, c3, c4, c6, (+ ` c1), (invg ` c1), c1)
  eqid((+ ` c1))
  eqid((invg ` c1))
}

blocks.name: lagsubg2
blocks.content: Lagrange's theorem for finite groups. Call the "order" of a group the cardinal number of the basic set of the group, and "index of a subgroup" the cardinal number of the set of left (or right, this is the same) cosets of this subgroup. Then the order of the group is the (cardinal) product of the order of any of its subgroups by the index of this subgroup. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 11-Jul-2014.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 12-Aug-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm lagsubg2(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(cfv(chash, c0), co(cfv(chash, cqs(c0, c1)), cmul, cfv(chash, c2))))
  -| wceq(c0, cfv(cbs, c3))
  -| wceq(c1, co(c3, cqg, c2))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, cfv(csubg, c3)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, cfn))
} = {
  3eqtr2d(cfv(chash, c0), co(cfv(chash, cqs(c0, c1)), cmul, cfv(chash, c2)), csu(hs0, cqs(c0, c1), cfv(chash, cv(hs0))), csu(hs0, cqs(c0, c1), cfv(chash, c2)), w0)
  qshash(hs0, c0, c1, w0)
  sumeq2dv(hs0, cqs(c0, c1), cfv(chash, c2), cfv(chash, cv(hs0)), w0)
  mpbird(wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), cqs(c0, c1))), wceq(cfv(chash, c2), cfv(chash, cv(hs0))), wbr(c2, cen, cv(hs0)))
  sylan(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), cqs(c0, c1)), wbr(c2, cen, cv(hs0)), wcel(c2, cfv(csubg, c3)))
  eqgen(c2, c3, cv(hs0), c0, c1)
  syl2anc(wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), cqs(c0, c1))), wb(wceq(cfv(chash, c2), cfv(chash, cv(hs0))), wbr(c2, cen, cv(hs0))), wcel(c2, cfn), wcel(cv(hs0), cfn))
  adantr(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), cqs(c0, c1)), wcel(c2, cfn))
  ssfid(cv(hs0), c0, wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), cqs(c0, c1))))
  adantr(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), cqs(c0, c1)), wcel(c0, cfn))
  elpwid(cv(hs0), c0, wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), cqs(c0, c1))))
  sselda(cv(hs0), cqs(c0, c1), cpw(c0), w0)
  hashen(c2, cv(hs0))
  syl2anc(w0, wceq(csu(hs0, cqs(c0, c1), cfv(chash, c2)), co(cfv(chash, cqs(c0, c1)), cmul, cfv(chash, c2))), wcel(cqs(c0, c1), cfn), wcel(cfv(chash, c2), cc))
  ssfid(cqs(c0, c1), cpw(c0), w0)
  sylib(w0, wcel(cpw(c0), cfn), wcel(c0, cfn))
  pwfi(c0)
  qsss(c0, c1, w0)
  syl(w0, wer(c1, c0), wcel(c2, cfv(csubg, c3)))
  eqger(c2, c3, c1, c0)
  nn0cnd(cfv(chash, c2), w0)
  syl(w0, wcel(cfv(chash, c2), cn0), wcel(c2, cfn))
  ssfid(c2, c0, w0)
  syl(w0, wss(c2, c0), wcel(c2, cfv(csubg, c3)))
  subgss(c2, c3, c0)
  hashcl(c2)
  fsumconst(hs0, cqs(c0, c1), cfv(chash, c2))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.w(w0)
  diff.hs0.c(cqs(c0, c1))
  diff.hs0.c(cfv(chash, c2))
}

thm lagsubg2(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  ‚ä¢ (w0 ‚Üí(# ` c0)=((# `(c0 /. c1))[√ó](# ` c2)))
  ‚ä£ c0 =(Base ` c3)
  ‚ä£ c1 =(c3[~QG]c2)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c2 ‚àà(SubGrp ` c3))
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c0 ‚àà Fin)
} = {
  3eqtr2d((# ` c0), ((# `(c0 /. c1))[√ó](# ` c2)), sum(hs0 ‚àà(c0 /. c1),(# ` hs0)), sum(hs0 ‚àà(c0 /. c1),(# ` c2)), w0)
  qshash(hs0, c0, c1, w0)
  sumeq2dv(hs0, (c0 /. c1), (# ` c2), (# ` hs0), w0)
  mpbird((w0 ‚àß hs0 ‚àà(c0 /. c1)), (# ` c2)=(# ` hs0), c2[‚âÖ]hs0)
  sylan(w0, hs0 ‚àà(c0 /. c1), c2[‚âÖ]hs0, c2 ‚àà(SubGrp ` c3))
  eqgen(c2, c3, hs0, c0, c1)
  syl2anc((w0 ‚àß hs0 ‚àà(c0 /. c1)), ((# ` c2)=(# ` hs0)‚Üî c2[‚âÖ]hs0), c2 ‚àà Fin, hs0 ‚àà Fin)
  adantr(w0, hs0 ‚àà(c0 /. c1), c2 ‚àà Fin)
  ssfid(hs0, c0, (w0 ‚àß hs0 ‚àà(c0 /. c1)))
  adantr(w0, hs0 ‚àà(c0 /. c1), c0 ‚àà Fin)
  elpwid(hs0, c0, (w0 ‚àß hs0 ‚àà(c0 /. c1)))
  sselda(hs0, (c0 /. c1), P(c0), w0)
  hashen(c2, hs0)
  syl2anc(w0, sum(hs0 ‚àà(c0 /. c1),(# ` c2))=((# `(c0 /. c1))[√ó](# ` c2)), (c0 /. c1)‚àà Fin, (# ` c2)‚àà ‚ÑÇ)
  ssfid((c0 /. c1), P(c0), w0)
  sylib(w0, P(c0)‚àà Fin, c0 ‚àà Fin)
  pwfi(c0)
  qsss(c0, c1, w0)
  syl(w0, c1[Er]c0, c2 ‚àà(SubGrp ` c3))
  eqger(c2, c3, c1, c0)
  nn0cnd((# ` c2), w0)
  syl(w0, (# ` c2)‚àà ‚Ñï0, c2 ‚àà Fin)
  ssfid(c2, c0, w0)
  syl(w0, c2 ‚äÜ c0, c2 ‚àà(SubGrp ` c3))
  subgss(c2, c3, c0)
  hashcl(c2)
  fsumconst(hs0, (c0 /. c1), (# ` c2))

blocks.name: lagsubg
blocks.content: Lagrange's theorem for Groups: the order of any subgroup of a finite group is a divisor of the order of the group. This is Metamath 100 proof #71. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 11-Jul-2014.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 12-Aug-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm lagsubg(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(csubg, c1)), wcel(c2, cfn)), wbr(cfv(chash, c0), cdvds, cfv(chash, c2)))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cbs, c1))
} = {
  breqtrrd(cfv(chash, c0), cdvds, cfv(chash, c2), co(cfv(chash, cqs(c2, co(c1, cqg, c0))), cmul, cfv(chash, c0)), wa(wcel(c0, cfv(csubg, c1)), wcel(c2, cfn)))
  syl2anc(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(csubg, c1)), wcel(c2, cfn)), wbr(cfv(chash, c0), cdvds, co(cfv(chash, cqs(c2, co(c1, cqg, c0))), cmul, cfv(chash, c0))), wcel(cfv(chash, cqs(c2, co(c1, cqg, c0))), cz), wcel(cfv(chash, c0), cz))
  nn0zd(cfv(chash, cqs(c2, co(c1, cqg, c0))), wa(wcel(c0, cfv(csubg, c1)), wcel(c2, cfn)))
  syl(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(csubg, c1)), wcel(c2, cfn)), wcel(cfv(chash, cqs(c2, co(c1, cqg, c0))), cn0), wcel(cqs(c2, co(c1, cqg, c0)), cfn))
  ssfid(cqs(c2, co(c1, cqg, c0)), cpw(c2), wa(wcel(c0, cfv(csubg, c1)), wcel(c2, cfn)))
  sylib(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(csubg, c1)), wcel(c2, cfn)), wcel(cpw(c2), cfn), wcel(c2, cfn))
  pwfi(c2)
  qsss(c2, co(c1, cqg, c0), wa(wcel(c0, cfv(csubg, c1)), wcel(c2, cfn)))
  adantr(wcel(c0, cfv(csubg, c1)), wcel(c2, cfn), wer(co(c1, cqg, c0), c2))
  eqger(c0, c1, co(c1, cqg, c0), c2)
  hashcl(cqs(c2, co(c1, cqg, c0)))
  nn0zd(cfv(chash, c0), wa(wcel(c0, cfv(csubg, c1)), wcel(c2, cfn)))
  syl(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(csubg, c1)), wcel(c2, cfn)), wcel(cfv(chash, c0), cn0), wcel(c0, cfn))
  syl2anr(wcel(c0, cfv(csubg, c1)), wcel(c2, cfn), wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c2, cfn), wss(c0, c2))
  id(wcel(c2, cfn))
  subgss(c0, c1, c2)
  ssfi(c2, c0)
  hashcl(c0)
  dvdsmul2(cfv(chash, cqs(c2, co(c1, cqg, c0))), cfv(chash, c0))
  lagsubg2(c2, co(c1, cqg, c0), c0, c1, wa(wcel(c0, cfv(csubg, c1)), wcel(c2, cfn)))
  eqid(co(c1, cqg, c0))
  simpl(wcel(c0, cfv(csubg, c1)), wcel(c2, cfn))
  simpr(wcel(c0, cfv(csubg, c1)), wcel(c2, cfn))
}

thm lagsubg(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  ‚ä¢ ((c0 ‚àà(SubGrp ` c1)‚àß c2 ‚àà Fin)‚Üí(# ` c0)[||](# ` c2))
  ‚ä£ c2 =(Base ` c1)
} = {
  breqtrrd((# ` c0), cdvds, (# ` c2), ((# `(c2 /.(c1[~QG]c0)))[√ó](# ` c0)), (c0 ‚àà(SubGrp ` c1)‚àß c2 ‚àà Fin))
  syl2anc((c0 ‚àà(SubGrp ` c1)‚àß c2 ‚àà Fin), (# ` c0)[||]((# `(c2 /.(c1[~QG]c0)))[√ó](# ` c0)), (# `(c2 /.(c1[~QG]c0)))‚àà ‚Ñ§, (# ` c0)‚àà ‚Ñ§)
  nn0zd((# `(c2 /.(c1[~QG]c0))), (c0 ‚àà(SubGrp ` c1)‚àß c2 ‚àà Fin))
  syl((c0 ‚àà(SubGrp ` c1)‚àß c2 ‚àà Fin), (# `(c2 /.(c1[~QG]c0)))‚àà ‚Ñï0, (c2 /.(c1[~QG]c0))‚àà Fin)
  ssfid((c2 /.(c1[~QG]c0)), P(c2), (c0 ‚àà(SubGrp ` c1)‚àß c2 ‚àà Fin))
  sylib((c0 ‚àà(SubGrp ` c1)‚àß c2 ‚àà Fin), P(c2)‚àà Fin, c2 ‚àà Fin)
  pwfi(c2)
  qsss(c2, (c1[~QG]c0), (c0 ‚àà(SubGrp ` c1)‚àß c2 ‚àà Fin))
  adantr(c0 ‚àà(SubGrp ` c1), c2 ‚àà Fin, (c1[~QG]c0)[Er]c2)
  eqger(c0, c1, (c1[~QG]c0), c2)
  hashcl((c2 /.(c1[~QG]c0)))
  nn0zd((# ` c0), (c0 ‚àà(SubGrp ` c1)‚àß c2 ‚àà Fin))
  syl((c0 ‚àà(SubGrp ` c1)‚àß c2 ‚àà Fin), (# ` c0)‚àà ‚Ñï0, c0 ‚àà Fin)
  syl2anr(c0 ‚àà(SubGrp ` c1), c2 ‚àà Fin, c0 ‚àà Fin, c2 ‚àà Fin, c0 ‚äÜ c2)
  id(c2 ‚àà Fin)
  subgss(c0, c1, c2)
  ssfi(c2, c0)
  hashcl(c0)
  dvdsmul2((# `(c2 /.(c1[~QG]c0))), (# ` c0))
  lagsubg2(c2, (c1[~QG]c0), c0, c1, (c0 ‚àà(SubGrp ` c1)‚àß c2 ‚àà Fin))
  eqid((c1[~QG]c0))
  simpl(c0 ‚àà(SubGrp ` c1), c2 ‚àà Fin)
  simpr(c0 ‚àà(SubGrp ` c1), c2 ‚àà Fin)
}
